Title: BEN IS BACK Official Trailer (2018) Julia Roberts, Lucas Hedges Drama Movie HD
Comment: I just watched the movie without watching the trailer or knowing what it was about. I saw Julia Roberts, and I knew I had to watch it. It brought back memmories and feelings that feel so fresh again. My exhusband is a recovering addict, and this movie made me sob like I have not in years. Many of the scenes were like a replay of what I, and others have gone trough. I often felt I would wake up to ugly news. I chased him in the car, looked for him on the street and parks, and freaked out when he locked himself in the bathroom... I felt scared for him and myself. We had a newborn daughter, and because of her and the love I had for her father, I left our home (for safety), but stayed around to support him and to wait for the day he would finally get clean. Today, our daughter is 7 and he has been clean for almost 5 years. Though we are not together, I will always love him as a friend and the father of my only child. Those of you who are struggling, stay strong. We believe in you!

Title: BEN IS BACK Official Trailer (2018) Julia Roberts, Lucas Hedges Drama Movie HD
Comment: I can't watch this movie, it's too close to home for me, I spent most of my life running from my ex, first baby's father who chose drugs over his family, I tried my best to keep my son safe and away from drugs, up until he suicided or accidental overdose at age 28, nothing good comes from drugs, my whole world changed that day and life will never be the same. we spoke of what he wanted to be done only 6 months before he passed, but it started out as a bit of joke me saying what to do with me when I died, I will never forget the look he gave me, saying mum the day you die is the day I die. It's hard just to breathe now without him, I feel so much guilt.

Title: BEN IS BACK Official Trailer (2018) Julia Roberts, Lucas Hedges Drama Movie HD
Comment: Drugs kill.  Some people have to die to find that out.  45 years ago I was 14.  Two of my buddies were 14, too, but they never made it past 19.  Each of us had the chance to become heroin dealers.  They decided to become heroin dealers, I did not.  One died in a shoot-out with police in Baltimore, the other went to prison and died there.  Life is about choices.  You choose to destroy your life and the lives of others with drugs, I have no sympathy for you and no damn empathy, either.  Thanks for the trailer but I've seen this movie in real life and I know how it ends, on the street, for real.

Comment:
I never tried drugs in my life, not even though of it. My mum left me when I was 1.5 years of age and I grow up with my dad and aunties surrounded by family. Honestly, I never felt what is the mum's felling is or look likes in my life or how it's feels, I used look at my friends at school surrounded by mums and dad and I used get frustrated and confused and I used seat in corner and cry and cry, I used the pain by the time.
First time I meet my mum I was 18 years of age.
Sorry everyone but it is a long story never ends. If anyone interested I can tell you the whole story and you can make a full movie out of it.
But I will never forgive my mum ever, selfish, arrogant, the cats are much better with her kittens.
So who ever has a good mother he blessed, just imagine your self growing up without a mum.
It is very very hard.
Sorry guys I am tearing.
